response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose and intent of this measure is to appropriate moneys for housing programs. [CHUNK_15] This measure appropriates funds to the Department of Human Services for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program and to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for the development of supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_11, CHUNK_12] It requires all kauhale projects to be connected to public utilities and authorizes them to charge monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level. [CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5]",
  "appropriations": "There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii an unspecified sum for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2] An unspecified sum from general revenues is also appropriated for the same fiscal years for the continued implementation of the ohana zones pilot program. [CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7] A third unspecified appropriation from general revenues for the same fiscal years is for the development, operation, and maintenance of affordable, supportive housing projects by the Hawaii housing finance and development corporation. [CHUNK_8, CHUNK_9, CHUNK_10]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "The fiscal note is based on the finding that Hawaii has the highest homelessness rate per capita in the United States. [CHUNK_19] It also assumes that the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program have successfully helped address homelessness in the State and that the appropriations in this measure will continue to support these critical programs. [CHUNK_20] The appropriation to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation is assumed to enable the development of supportive housing units for households with special needs. [CHUNK_21]",
  "agency_impact": "This measure changes the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [CHUNK_23] The sums appropriated for these two programs shall be expended by the department of human services. [CHUNK_5, CHUNK_7] The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation remains the expending agency for the appropriation for supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_10]",
  "economic_impact": "The Committee finds that Hawaii has the highest homelessness rate per capita in the United States. [CHUNK_19] The appropriations in this measure will continue to support critical programs that have successfully helped address homelessness in the State. [CHUNK_20] This measure also authorizes the kauhale initiative to charge monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level, which may impact the finances of residents. [CHUNK_5]",
  "policy_impact": "A key policy change in this measure is changing the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [CHUNK_23] The measure also establishes new requirements for kauhale, mandating that they be connected to public utilities. [CHUNK_22] Furthermore, it newly authorizes that monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level be charged for kauhale. [CHUNK_22, CHUNK_23]",
  "revenue_sources": "The appropriations for the kauhale initiative, ohana zones pilot program, and supportive housing projects are from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_8] The measure also creates a potential new revenue stream by providing that the kauhale initiative may charge monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level. [CHUNK_5] No other revenue sources are identified. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_8]",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The bill appropriates unspecified sums from the general fund for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027 for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative, the continued implementation of the ohana zones pilot program, and for the development of supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_9] The Kauhale Initiative appropriation is intended for expenses including development, operation, rent supplement payments, support services, staffing, wrap around services, and transportation. [CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3] This measure changes the expending agency for the Kauhale and Ohana Zones programs to the Department of Human Services, which will have a long-term impact on that department's budget and resource allocation. [CHUNK_23] The Committee recognizes that these programs have successfully helped address homelessness and that the appropriations will continue to support these critical programs, implying a fiscal commitment beyond the initial two-year period. [CHUNK_20] The new requirement for kauhale to be connected to public utilities may have ongoing maintenance costs. [CHUNK_4] The authorization to charge rent may offset a small portion of operating costs in future years. [CHUNK_5]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "This version of the measure introduces a new potential source of operating revenue for kauhale projects. [CHUNK_5] The bill now specifies that the kauhale initiative may charge monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level. [CHUNK_5] This could provide a revenue stream to offset operational costs, which was not authorized in the previous version. [CHUNK_23]",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "The measure appropriates funds for the development and operation of kauhale and for the development, operation, and maintenance of affordable, supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_2, CHUNK_9] A new provision requires that all kauhale projects shall be connected to public utilities, including water, sewer, and electricity. [CHUNK_4] This requirement will likely result in capital expenditures for new projects to ensure utility connections are established. [CHUNK_4]",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The Committee recognizes that the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program have successfully helped address homelessness in the State. [CHUNK_20] Given that Hawaii has the highest homelessness rate per capita in the United States, there is a continued need for these programs. [CHUNK_19] Sustained funding for operations, services, and development of additional supportive housing will likely be required beyond the six-year horizon to continue addressing homelessness and housing instability. [CHUNK_20]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "This measure has been amended by changing the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [CHUNK_23] Two new provisions affecting the kauhale initiative have been added: requiring kauhale to be connected to public utilities, and authorizing monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale. [CHUNK_22, CHUNK_23] Preambles that were in the previous version have also been removed. [CHUNK_22]",
  "fte_positions": "The appropriation for the kauhale initiative includes funding for staffing and related costs to administer the initiative. [CHUNK_3] Following the amendments in this version, the Department of Human Services will be the expending agency responsible for this staffing. [CHUNK_5] The bill does not specify the number of Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7, CHUNK_8, CHUNK_9, CHUNK_10]",
  "appropriations_changes": "While the appropriation amounts remain unspecified for fiscal years 2025-2026 and 2026-2027, the expending agency has been changed for two of the three appropriations. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_8] The sums appropriated for the continued operation of the kauhale initiative and the continued implementation of the ohana zones pilot program are now to be expended by the department of human services. [CHUNK_5, CHUNK_7]",
  "funding_sources_changes": "The primary funding source for all appropriations in the bill continues to be the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [CHUNK_1, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_8] This version adds a new provision authorizing the kauhale initiative to charge monthly rents, which could serve as a supplemental program-based revenue source, but does not alter the funding source for the state appropriations. [CHUNK_5]",
  "department_impact": "The measure was amended by changing the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services. [CHUNK_23] As a result, the sums appropriated for the kauhale initiative and the ohana zones pilot program shall be expended by the department of human services. [CHUNK_5, CHUNK_7] The Hawaii housing finance and development corporation remains the expending agency for funds related to the development of supportive housing projects. [CHUNK_10]",
  "reports_required": "The provided documents do not contain information regarding any reports required to be submitted to the legislature. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7, CHUNK_8, CHUNK_9, CHUNK_10, CHUNK_11, CHUNK_12, CHUNK_13, CHUNK_14, CHUNK_15, CHUNK_16, CHUNK_17, CHUNK_18, CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20, CHUNK_21, CHUNK_22, CHUNK_23, CHUNK_24, CHUNK_25, CHUNK_26]",
  "pilot_program": "This measure appropriates funds for the continued implementation of the ohana zones pilot program established under Act 209, Session Laws of Hawaii 2018. [CHUNK_7] Your Committee recognizes that the Ohana Zones Pilot Program has successfully helped address homelessness in the State. [CHUNK_20] The program remains a pilot program under this measure. [CHUNK_7]",
  "sunset_date": "The provided documents do not contain a sunset date for the appropriations or programs funded by this measure. [CHUNK_0, CHUNK_1, CHUNK_2, CHUNK_3, CHUNK_4, CHUNK_5, CHUNK_6, CHUNK_7, CHUNK_8, CHUNK_9, CHUNK_10, CHUNK_11, CHUNK_12, CHUNK_13, CHUNK_14, CHUNK_15, CHUNK_16, CHUNK_17, CHUNK_18, CHUNK_19, CHUNK_20, CHUNK_21, CHUNK_22, CHUNK_23, CHUNK_24, CHUNK_25, CHUNK_26]",
  "effective_date": "This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. [CHUNK_10] This effective date is unchanged from the previous version of the bill. [CHUNK_10]"
}

SSCR1528 STAND. COM. REP. NO. 1528 Honolulu, Hawaii RE: H.B. No. 431 H.D. 2 S.D. 2 Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Sir: Your Committee on Ways and Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2,

Means, to which was referred H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO HOUSING," begs leave to report as follows: The purpose and intent of this measure is to appropriate moneys for housing programs. More specifically, the measure appropriates moneys to: (1) The

programs. More specifically, the measure appropriates moneys to: (1) The Office of the Governor for the continued implementation of the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program; and (2) The Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation for the development of supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for

supportive housing projects and the provision of supportive services for certain households in the supportive housing projects. Your Committee received written comments in support of this measure from the Office of the Governor, Department of Human Services, Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation, State Council on Developmental Disabilities, Statewide Office

and Development Corporation, State Council on Developmental Disabilities, Statewide Office on Homelessness and Housing Solutions, County of Hawaii Office of Housing and Community Development, Ava Sofia Foundation DBA Autism Moms of Kona, Catholic Charities Hawaii, Easterseals Hawaii, Full Life, Hawaii Community Foundation, Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition, Kokua Kona, Maui Chamber

Community Foundation, Hawaii Substance Abuse Coalition, Kokua Kona, Maui Chamber of Commerce, Pacific Housing Assistance Corporation, and six individuals. Your Committee finds that Hawaii has the highest homelessness rate per capita in the United States. Your Committee also finds that there is a need for affordable housing that includes access

there is a need for affordable housing that includes access to services for special needs populations. Your Committee recognizes that the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program have successfully helped address homelessness in the State, and that the appropriations in this measure will continue to support these critical programs.

in this measure will continue to support these critical programs. Your Committee further recognizes that the appropriation to the Hawaii Housing Finance and Development Corporation in this measure will enable the development of supportive housing units for households with special needs. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Removing

needs. Your Committee has amended this measure by: (1) Removing the preambles contained in sections 1 and 4 of the measure; (2) Requiring kauhale to be connected to public utilities; (3) Authorizing monthly rents of no more than thirty per cent of the area median income level to be charged

cent of the area median income level to be charged for kauhale; (4) Changing the appropriation expending agency for the Kauhale Initiative and Ohana Zones Pilot Program from the Office of the Governor to the Department of Human Services; and (5) Making technical, nonsubstantive changes for purposes of clarity, consistency

(5) Making technical, nonsubstantive changes for purposes of clarity, consistency and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the members of your Committee on Ways and Means that is attached to this report, your Committee is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D.

with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 1, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Third Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 431, H.D. 2, S.D. 2. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the members of the Committee on Ways and Means,
of the members of the Committee on Ways and Means, ________________________________ DONOVAN M. DELA CRUZ, Chair

overview.prompt: Using the provided legislative documents, statutes, and testimonies, write a clear summary describing the purpose, scope, and key components of the proposed measure or bill, including any pilot or permanent programs, reporting requirements, and sunset clauses. This should be around 3 sentences.
overview.description: General overview and summary of the measure

appropriations.prompt: Based on budgetary data and legislative appropriations, detail the funding allocated for the program or measure, including fiscal years, amounts, intended uses such as staffing, training, contracts, technology, etc... This should be around 3 sentences.

assumptions_and_methodology.prompt: Explain the assumptions, cost estimation methods, and data sources used to calculate the financial projections for this program or measure, referencing comparable programs or historical budgets where applicable. This should be around 3 sentences.

agency_impact.prompt: Describe the anticipated operational, administrative, and budgetary impact of the program or measure on the relevant government agency or department, including supervision, staffing, and resource allocation. This should be around 3 sentences.
agency_impact.description: Impact on government agencies and departments

economic_impact.prompt: Summarize the expected economic effects of the program or measure, such as cost savings, potential reductions in related expenditures, benefits to the community, and any relevant performance or participation statistics. This should be around 3 sentences.

policy_impact.prompt: Analyze the policy implications of the measure, including how it modifies existing laws or programs, its role within broader legislative strategies, and its potential effects on state or local governance. This should be around 3 sentences.

revenue_sources.prompt: Identify and describe the funding sources that will support the program or measure, such as general funds, grants, fees, or other revenue streams, based on the provided fiscal documents. This should be around 3 sentences.

six_year_fiscal_implications.prompt: Provide a multi-year fiscal outlook (e.g., six years) for the program or measure, projecting costs, staffing changes, recurring expenses, and assumptions about program expansion or permanence using available budget and workload data. This should be around 10 sentences.

operating_revenue_impact.prompt: Describe any anticipated impacts on operating revenues resulting from the program or measure, including increases, decreases, or changes in revenue streams. This should be around 3 sentences.

capital_expenditure_impact.prompt: Outline any expected capital expenditures related to the program or measure, such as investments in facilities, equipment, or technology infrastructure, based on capital budgets or agency plans. This should be around 3 sentences.

fiscal_implications_after_6_years.prompt: Summarize the ongoing fiscal obligations after the initial multi-year period for the program or measure, including annual operating costs, expected number of program sites or units, and the sustainability of funding. This should be around 3 sentences.
fiscal_implications_after_6_years.description: Long-term fiscal obligations beyond six years

updates_from_previous_fiscal_note.prompt: If you are given a previous fiscal note. Please summarize the MAIN POINTS that are different from the previous fiscal note and the new fiscal note.

fte_positions.prompt: Detail any Full Time Equivalent (FTE) positions that have been added or modified in this version of the bill, including the number of positions, their roles, and any changes from previous versions. This should be around 3 sentences.

appropriations_changes.prompt: Identify and describe any appropriations that were previously unspecified or have been modified between versions of the bill, including the amounts and purposes of the appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
appropriations_changes.description: Changes to appropriations between bill versions

funding_sources_changes.prompt: Specify the method of funding (MOF) for appropriations and identify any changes in funding sources between versions, such as shifts between general fund and special fund appropriations. This should be around 3 sentences.
funding_sources_changes.description: Changes to funding sources and method of funding

department_impact.prompt: Describe any changes in which department is responsible for expending appropriations, including shifts from one department to another between bill versions (e.g., from Department of Health to Judiciary). This should be around 3 sentences.
department_impact.description: Changes in department responsibility for appropriations

reports_required.prompt: Identify any reports that agencies are required to submit to the legislature, including new reporting requirements or modifications to existing ones. This should be around 3 sentences.

pilot_program.prompt: If the bill creates a pilot program, describe the length of the pilot program and whether it was initially intended to be a pilot program or a permanent program. This should be around 3 sentences.

sunset_date.prompt: Identify the sunset date for the bill or program, including any modifications to the sunset date between versions. This should be around 2 sentences.

effective_date.prompt: Identify the effective date of the bill, noting if there was a defective effective date in a previous version and what the corrected effective date is. This should be around 2 sentences.
